translation: Text for Receiving the Five and Eight Precepts (Hai)
text of the eight precepts
The First Chapter of the Commendation for Realization
"The disciples, everyone, ...

source_sentence: 稽首和南虛空法界無上種智。
translation: They bow their heads in salutation to the unsurpassed seed cognition of the space and dharma realms.
He who rides the form and records the body and becomes perfectly enlightened.
Mohe Prajñāpāramitā is the vast One Vehicle.
The sages of the tenth ground and the three great men of goodness.
They are the lords and gods of the space, the hidden and the visible.
He's a member of the retinue of Brahmā in the form and formless heavens.
The officials who assist the world-protecting Tathāgata.
The fire deities of the underworld, the CaoLao, and the Māra lords.
May it be today.
With the pure divine eye, I'd see all of them.
He respectfully, sincerely, and wholeheartedly requests them.
Second Chapter on Cleansing and Repentance of Past Actions
"The disciples are a group of people who have joined the site of the path.
From beginningless time until today, we've accumulated measureless sins that are unfathomable in their limits.
The accumulated sins are immeasurable, and the limits are unfathomable.
They've created numerous offenses and seldom investigated their limits.
They've developed a lack of faith in the Three Treasures.
They conduct an unchaste practice toward the honored ones in the ten directions.
Even if he kills, harms, steals, and commits wrongdoing.
Even with their mouths, they speak false words and harsh insults.
Even so, his mind craves anger, ill-will, and folly.
From this, limitless bad actions are produced in abundance.
They reincarnate the three existences, drown in the four currents, and are subject to the five hindrances that cover the mind and the ten tethers.
The five hindrances cover the mind with ten fetters and delude the mind.
There's no hope of liberation from these five hindrances, which always reside in the mundane realm.
The Sanskrit word for repentance is kanaka, which means to repent of one's faults.
From now on, it's cutting off continuing mind.
He always wishes to extinguish past sins.
The Third Chapter of the Three Refuges for Attaining the Precepts
"The disciples and others in the congregation combine to form the site of the path.
They take refuge in the Buddha, the most honored among two-legged beings.
They take refuge in the Venerable Free From Desire, according to the Dharma.
They take refuge in the venerable among the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 惟願三寶慈悲證明哀憐攝受(三說)弟子眾等合道場人。
translation: May the compassion of the Three Treasures prove that they compassionately accept (three teachings) the multitude of disciples and others who are united on the site of enlightenment.
After taking refuge in the Buddha, we took refuge in the Dharma.
I've given refuge in the Dharma!
I've finished taking refuge in the saṃgha.
I received the eight precepts and approached the abode of discipline.

source_sentence: 願尊憶持慈悲護念(三說)。
translation: May Your Holiness recall them and compassionately guard their memory (three teachings).
The Fourth Chapter of the Questions, Holding, and Explaining (3 explanations)
"All Buddhist disciples, listen closely.
This is called the eight precepts.
They are one not killing and two not stealing.
Two, don't steal.
Three are not to defile desire.
Four, don't lie.
Five, don't drink alcohol or eat meat.

source_sentence: 六不香油塗身及鬘花莊飾。
translation: Six, they don't rub their bodies with scented oil and adorn themselves with flowers and garlands.

source_sentence: 七不作倡伎樂故往觀聽。
translation: Seven, they don't engage in excessive music and go there to listen.

source_sentence: 八不上高大床及過中食。
translation: Eight, he doesn't go onto a high, large bed or eat in excess.
From now until tomorrow morning, at sunrise, he'll follow the Buddha's lead in leaving home one day and one night.
For a day and a night, he follows the Buddha out of the house.
During this time of leisure, he mustn't transgress.
Can he uphold it?
Chapter 5: Vowing for the Return of the Buddha's Teachings
"The disciples are a group of people who meet at the site of the path.

source_sentence: 受戒善緣盡將迴向法界含生。
translation: We'll end the good causes for receiving the precepts and return to the Dharma realm to include birth.
May deludedly attached emotions and deluded hindrances be ended.
nondiscriminating cognition will be clearly understood and manifested.
They will blaze through the practice of the teachings that have characteristics.
He traverses the world of the lotus store and follows it.
The mind of the tathāgatagarbha deeply understands its root.
Those who have yet to realize it will realize it, and those who have yet to perfect it will perfect it.
In the ocean of sentient beings, he always vows to become a buddha.
Verse of the Five Precepts
"All worldlings are deluded about their original awakening nature.
They reside in the three existences according to their deluded transmigration.
As a result, the six destinies are delineated, and humans and gods are separated.
The Buddha has five precepts for people to uphold.
From the approach of skillful means, they enter the principle of true characteristics.
First Chapter on Stirring Up Sincere Requests
"The multitude of his disciples are united with those on the site of enlightenment.

source_sentence: 仰啟十方虛空法界成正覺者。
translation: They look up and inspire those who have become perfectly enlightened in the Dharma realm of space in the ten directions.
He who turns the wheel of the Dharma and attains parinirvāṇa.
These are the true, good teachers of our group.
It's because I was taken in by the great doctor king.
He's a single flavor of ghee from the infinite treasury of the Dharma.
It's the half-complete, full-voice, Mahāyāna teaching.
It's good medicine for me, and it's my boat's voyage.
It's because he's rescued me from the river of birth and death.
The noble congregation of the three vehicles and the eight groups of monks.
They're the śrāvakas, the contaminated compassionate bodhisattvas, and the tranquil ones.
They'll have compassion for us as a group.
They'll look after me like a sick person and rescue me.

source_sentence: 惟願三寶弘誓願力不思議力。
translation: May the Three Treasures have the power of their vast vows and inconceivable power.
Within their true nature, they arouse unconditional compassion.
Accept our invitation today.
Second Chapter on Repentance for Past Misdeeds
"My fellow disciples are people who have joined the field of the Way.
They've been foolish for a long time and have come to this day.
Because they don't understand the ultimate truth.

source_sentence: 生諸障門煩惱所知迷事迷理。
translation: They give rise to the gate of hindrances, afflictions, knowledge, deluded phenomena, and confused principles.

source_sentence: 觸境起業隨緣造愆身起三支口犯四過。
translation: Contact with objects gives rise to karma that creates transgressions based on conditions, and the body gives rise to the three limbs, and speech violates the four faults.
The mind's three courses of action continue to grow deeper and deeper.
They're like sand or dust, and their number is countless.
He doesn't realize that his body contains four vipers in its container.
The five caityas and six aggregates of emptiness are formed.
They receive fraudulent, well-intentioned, and numerous bad causes.
They drive consciousness and mind through the five destinies of transmigration.

source_sentence: 從此積集八萬四千人間。
translation: From this, 84,000 human beings are accumulated.
There are no faults or unwholesome actions that aren't created.
It's now that I've examined my body and mind.
I present it to the Buddha with the general vow to extinguish it.
Chapter 3: Turning from Error to Respect
"The disciples are a group of people who meet at the site of the path.
They take refuge in the Buddha, the unsurpassed honored one.
They take refuge in the Venerable Abandoner of Desire according to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 歸依僧眾中尊自從今日以佛為師。
translation: They take refuge in the venerable among the saṃgha, and from now on, they take the Buddha as their teacher.
We mustn't give refuge to other heretics and non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 惟願三寶慈悲證明哀憐攝受(三說)。
translation: May the compassion of the Three Treasures prove that they compassionately accept (three teachings).
The disciples were united with the people of the site of enlightenment.
We've finished taking refuge in the Buddha.
I've finished taking refuge in the Dharma.
After taking refuge in the saṃgha, we did so.
It was the Buddha, Bhagavān, and Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 多陀阿伽度阿羅訶三藐三佛陀。
translation: 'Tathāgata, Agastya, Araha, Samyak-saṃbuddha.'
He's my great teacher.

source_sentence: 我今歸依願佛攝受(三說)。
translation: I now take refuge in the Buddha and wish to have him take me in (three explanations).
The Fourth Explanation of the Combined Practice of Societies
"Buddhist disciples, listen closely.
This is called the upāsaka precept.
It means one doesn't kill ...
Two, don't steal.
Three don't engage in wrong behavior.
Four don't lie.
The fifth is not to drink alcohol or eat meat.
From the present time until the end of the future, they mustn't transgress it.
In the interim, they mustn't violate it.
Can he maintain it?
Chapter 5: Returning to the Vow Ocean
"The disciples are a group of people who meet at the site of the path.
They've received the precepts in the past.
They're directed toward the ocean of the true nature of enlightenment.
All sentient beings in the four streams and three realms.
We always wish to arouse the intention to cultivate the practice of Samantabhadra.
They never abandon the buddha seed and are born into the Tathāgata's family.
He'll also extend his great compassion and reveal it.
He'll obtain the jewel in his topknot and the pearl in his robe.
He'll sit on the site of enlightenment with the general vow to become a buddha.
One Fascicle of the Text for Receiving the Five and Eight Precepts
